head.title: WSO2 Web Services Authoring and Testing Tools Release Notes

html.body:
WSO2 Web Services Authoring and Testing Tools 1.1.1 Release Notes
9th October 2009
WSO2 Web Services Authoring and Testing Tools is a set of tools provided by WSO2 for the purpose of authoring common and vital web service functionalities during their development phase. The tools are created as plugins for the popular IDE Eclipse.
The tools are tagetted for authoring axis2 web services.
These tools are available under the
Apache Software License (v2.0)
. This includes all of the extra integration and management functionality as well.
Key Features
Create Web services
Create web service client
Convert WSDL 1.1 to 2.0 and vice versa as well
Module and service validators
Creating wsdl from a java class
Create Axis2 archives
Hot update a Web service
Debug Web services
Test Web services
The full feature list is available at
http://wso2.org/projects/tools/wsas/wsas-authoring/features
Known Issues
The tools depend upon Eclipse WTP 3.0 (Ganymede) or later
Recommended version of Java is jdk 1.5 or 1.6
The 'Test Web Services' feature does not work for MTOM enabled services.
